intro: Aeschynomene soniae, commonly known as coastal aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant is often found growing in sandy or saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh coastal environments. It plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion due to its extensive root system. Aeschynomene soniae is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
